column1: TS14019,Contract,"Derbyshire County Council",Awarded,2017-01-24T08:56:12Z,"Supply of Tutor Led and Computer Based Specialist ICT Training","Derbyshire County Council is seeking Quote Responses to provide an externally hosted web-based training Solution and tutor led training including examinations for Specialist ICT courses.
The requirement is separated into 2 Lots, suppliers may submit tenders for single or multiple Lots.
Lot 1: Tutor led training: Onsite or Public Scheduled training including, as a minimum:
• On-site and scheduled classroom training; and
Lot 2: Computer Based Training: an externally hosted Solution, accessible through the internet, with the following functionality, as a minimum:
• A platform to access Computer Based Training and other online resources providing a catalogue of eLearning courses covering a wide range of ICT topics;
• A forum for frequently asked questions;
• A robust solution to be accessible 24/7;
• An externally hosted solution that is accessible through the internet and compatible with the Council's current infrastructure.
The estimated value of these Lots over the life of the Contract is as follows:

column1: Corporate Training - RFQ,Contract,"NHS PROFESSIONALS LIMITED",Awarded,2016-04-22T16:05:57Z,"Corporate Training - RFQ","NHS Professionals is seeking an independent Supplier to provide training services for a range of professional courses with particular emphasis on business and technology training.

The majority of courses will be held at the supplier’s classroom based training sites in England, with particular emphasis on locations in and around the Central London area and Leeds. These being the primary locations of NHS Professionals staff. On occasion NHSP may require on-site based training. Travel and accommodation will be provided.
Full details of the requirements are available on NHSP's BravoSolution site: www.nhsp.bravosolution.co.uk.
To gain access please navigate to the site, view open opportunities and select Corporate Training.

Due to time constraints Wednesday 27th April has been set as the deadline for submissions. NHSP intends to evaluate on the 28th April and inform Tenderers of the result on the 29th April.",,"WD17 1JW","East of England","79632000 79633000 ","David Waddington",tenders@nhsprofessionals.nhs.uk,"Phoenix House",,Tingley,"WF3 1SN",England,,,,"www.nhsp.bravosolution.co.uk ",,29/04/2016,28/04/2018,27/04/2016,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,50000,50000,16/05/2016,50000,"[QA Ltd

column1: SUN001-DN302261-49018737,Contract,"Sunderland City Council",Awarded,2018-03-08T09:02:53Z,"Apprenticeship Levy - Multi Provider Flexible Procurement Agreement for the Provision of Apprenticeship Training","This is a notice for Administrative social, educational, healthcare and cultural services in accordance with Directive 2014/24/EU/Article/74.These services are within the scope of Schedule 3 of The Public Contracts Regulations 2015 No 102 and are therefore subject to the 'light touch' public procurement regime in accordance with Section 7 of the 2015 Regulations.
Individual codes include: 80 000 000 Education and training services.

All operators interested in this Request to Participate should register an expression of interest online at 'www.neporportal.org' , Request to Participate Reference DN302261. All Request to Participate documents are available via this portal.

The Council wishes to enter into a flexible procurement agreement with multiple training providers to deliver on a call-off basis high quality apprenticeship training from intermediate level to degree level across a variety of areas of study throughout the Council.For this agreement there will be 4 Lots as set out below based on the core Council service areas and each Lot will then contain a number of specific areas of specialist study within that Lot.

Lot 4 - People Services.The Council reserves the right at its discretion through the term of the Agreement to advertise opportunities for additional providers to participate in this proposed Flexible Procurement Agreement in the following circumstances:
(i) There are no existing ranked providers for a specialist study area within a Lot; or

(ii) None of the ranked providers for a specialist study area have the capacity to perform an individual call-off requirement or they reject the call-off requirement.",,,"North East","80000000 ","Julie Rogerson",julie.rogerson@sunderland.gov.uk,"Civic Centre","Burdon Road",Sunderland,"SR2 7DN","United Kingdom","+44 1915611772",http://www.sunderland.gov.uk/,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=bb3ce73d-52af-e711-80e6-005056b64545 ",,08/12/2017,07/12/2021,16/11/2017,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,500000,500000,27/02/2018,2880000,"[Absolute Care Training & Education Ltd

column1: 20190810163118-32217,Contract,"East Midlands Strategic Commercial Unit (EMSCU)",Awarded,2019-08-10T16:31:23Z,"IT Training Programme Framework","EMSCU is acting on behalf of the Contracting Authority to undertake a compliant EU tender exercise using the light touch regime under Schedule 3 (Open Procedure) of the Public Contract Regulations (2015) to establish a national framework agreement for IT Training Programme. The Framework Consists of three Lots:
Lot 3 Bespoke / Custom Courses. Bidders that have been awarded either Lots 1 or 2 will also be awarded Lot 3 if they have the ability to provide (Not Scored)

This Lot will cover the provision of ""off the shelf"" solutions and specialist education and training for IT professionals of a technical nature. Typical activities required under this Lot include, but are not restricted to the attached course list.
Technical training could include blended learning offerings, e.g. e-learning, remote access, classroom, on site.

This Lot will cover the provision of ""off the shelf"" solutions and specialist education and training for IT professionals of a non-technical nature which includes business and soft skills. Typical activities required under this Lot include, but are not restricted to the attached course list.
Non-technical training could include blended learning offerings, e.g. e-learning, remote access, classroom, on site.
**Please Note: Can only be awarded to a Supplier that has been awarded at least one lot (1 or 2).Users of Lot 3 will only be able to conduct Mini Competition (No Direct Award)**

This Lot will cover the provision of bespoke/custom solutions and specialist education and training for IT professionals. This is expected to be for softer skills. However, could include technical and non-technical business skills. Typical topic areas required under this Lot include, but are not restricted to:

Bespoke/custom could include blended learning offerings, e.g. e-learning, remote access, classroom, on site.",,,"Any region","48000000 72000000 80000000 80500000 ","Alec George",alec.george@emscu.pnn.police.uk,"c/o East Midlands Strategic Commercial Unit (EMSCU), Nottinghamshire Police, Force Headquarters, Sherwood Lodge, Arnold",,Nottinghamshire,"NG5 8PP",ENG,"+44 115967999",,,"https://uk.eu-supply.com/app/rfq/rwlentrance_s.asp?PID=28041&B=BLUELIGHT https://uk.eu-supply.com/ctm/Company/CompanyInformation/Index/32217 ",,14/05/2019,30/06/2023,13/05/2019,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,0,50000000,13/06/2019,50000000,"[Global Knowledge Networks Training Ltd

column1: LPOOL001-DN450381-11182476,Contract,"Liverpool City Council",Awarded,2020-08-18T15:24:45Z,"Learning and Development Framework","The Authority is seeking providers to deliver training requirements for internal Liverpool City Council Employeesvia liaison with the Learning and Development department.

Liverpool City Council is committed to being an employer of choice and an Investor in People. Development ofour staff is an investment for the future and the City Council recognises that everyone needs support, trainingand development. The Inclusive Growth Plan, launched in March 2018, describes how our city and the Councilwill be transformed to deliver our vision and priorities. The Transformation plan includes an action to developour workforce as our greatest asset and we need to ensure they are inspired and have the necessary skills tosuccessfully deliver our transformation agenda whilst also meeting mandatory and legislative requirements andresponsibilities.

Lot 2 - Technical ICT Skills",,,"North West","80000000 ","Greg Nixon",greg.nixon@liverpool.gov.uk,"4th Floor, Cunard Building",,Liverpool,"L3 1DS",England,,http://www.liverpool.gov.uk,,,,02/03/2020,31/03/2024,23/01/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,340000,340000,18/08/2020,340000,"[The Training Co.
